🪔The Indian Garden is one of the four Heritage Gardens at Gardens by the Bay.
The Indian Garden is designed in a traditional Indian floral motif layout.
Hexagonally shaped, the floor has a floral motif design imprint on it.
🪔An intricate 3-layered floral-shaped fountain located at the Garden infuse an Indian charm to the entire Garden.
🪔The Garden is adorned with animals statues like the lions, elephants and camels.
The entire layout and its displays showcased the Indian traditions and its rich cultural tapestry.

Went to see the light spectacle and missed most of it which was a shame, make sure you are early and go on the path and bridge under the light trees to get the best experience.

We saw a bit and then went to the fountain show which is also well worth it and just on the other side.

Wear some really comfortable shoes, we walked about 28,000 steps this day!

The Indian Garden is a vibrant showcase of Indian culture and heritage nestled within the verdant landscapes of Gardens by the Bay, offering visitors an immersive journey through the traditions, artistry, and diversity of Indian life. Designed to reflect the cultural and natural landscapes of India, this captivating garden features lush foliage, colorful blooms, and traditional architectural elements that pay homage to the rich tapestry of Indian culture. From the ornate carvings and intricate patterns of traditional Indian houses to the serene water features and tranquil pathways, the Indian Garden offers a glimpse into the warmth, hospitality, and cultural richness of the Indian community. Whether exploring the vibrant bazaars, savoring traditional cuisine, or simply admiring the beauty of the natural surroundings, visitors can experience the vibrant spirit and cultural heritage of the Indian Garden at Gardens by the Bay.
